rdvalue.c

Go to the documentation of this file.
00001 /*****************************************************************************
00002 
00003   Routine: ReadValue
00004  
00005   Description: Parses an ODL value given as ASCII text and assigns it to a
00006                specified parameter. The input text string may contain any
00007                ODL scalar, sequence or set value.  This routine is used to
00008                process values entered in text format as input to label
00009                editors and similar programs.  To do its job, this routine
00010                forms an ODL parameter assignment statement and then calls
00011                the ODL parser to parse the statement and place the results
00012                onto an ODL tree.
00013 
00014   Input:
00015           node         -   Pointer to the aggregate node to which the
00016                            parameter and value are to be attached.
00017           parameter_name - Character string containing the parameter name.
00018           value_string -   Character string containing the value in ASCII
00019                            text format.
00020  
00021   Output: A value of one is returned as the function value if parsing was
00022           completed successfully; otherwise a value of zero is returned.
00023  
00024   Author:  Randy Davis, University of Colorado LASP
00025 
00026   Creation Date:  09 October 1990
00027   Last Modified:  18 May 1991
00028 
00029   History:
00030 
00031     Creation - This routine first appeared in Version 2.0 of the ODLC library.
00032 
00033     Version 2.1 - 13 March 1991 - Randy Davis, U. of Colorado LASP
00034       a) Set global variable ODLlinenumber_flag to FALSE to indicate that
00035          line numbers shouldn't be included in error messages generated
00036          by the parser when called by this routine.
00037 
00038   Version 2.2 - 18 May 1991 - M. DeMore, Jet Propulsion Laboratory
00039     a) Removed include statements that were Unix specific and placed them
00040        in odldef.h.
00041 
00042 *****************************************************************************/
00043 
00044 #include "odldef.h"
00045 
00046 /* The following statements duplicate two lexical analyzer constants for
00047    use in this module */
00048 
00049 #define YYLMAX BUFSIZ
00050 #define YYNEWLINE 10
00051 
00052 /* The following statements define a routine for placing characters into
00053    the lexical analyzer's rescan buffer */
00054 
00055 #define unput(X) for (nc=strlen(X); nc > 0; yyunput(X[--nc]))
00056 
00057 extern int nc;                                 /* Number of characters to unput    */
00058 
00059 /* The following variables are defined in the module containing the
00060    parser action routines. */
00061 
00062 extern AGGREGATE  ODLroot_node;         /* Pointer to root node of ODL tree */
00063 extern AGGREGATE  ODLcurrent_aggregate; /* Pointer to current aggregate node*/
00064 
00065 extern int        ODLerror_count;       /* Cumulative count of errors       */
00066 extern int        ODLwarning_count;     /* Cumulative count of warnings     */
00067 extern int        ODLlinenumber_flag;   /* Flag to control line no. output  */
00068 
00069 /* The following variables are defined in the lexical analyzer module */
00070 
00071 extern FILE *yyin;                  /* Pointer to file for parser input     */
00072 extern FILE *yyout;                 /* Pointer to file for parser output    */
00073 
00074 extern char  yysbuf[YYLMAX];        /* Lexical analysis rescan buffer       */
00075 extern char *yysptr;                /* Pointer into lexical rescan buffer   */
00076 
00077 extern int   yylineno;              /* Current input line number            */
00078 extern int   yyprevious;            /* Previous lexical analysis state      */
00079 
00080 
00081 int ReadValue (
00082 
00083      AGGREGATE    node,
00084      char        *parameter_name,
00085      char        *value_string)
00086 
00087 {
00088 
00089   /* Reset pointers for the files to be used by the parser */
00090 
00091   yyin  = NULL;
00092   yyout = NULL;
00093 
00094   /* Reset other variables used by the lexical analyzer */
00095 
00096   yyprevious = YYNEWLINE;
00097   yysptr = yysbuf;
00098   yylineno = 1;
00099   
00100   /* Initialize the error and warning counters, and reset the line number
00101      output flag so that line numbers won't be reported in any error
00102      messages */
00103 
00104   ODLerror_count       = 0;
00105   ODLwarning_count     = 0;
00106   ODLlinenumber_flag   = 0;
00107 
00108   /* Initialize the node pointers */
00109 
00110   ODLroot_node         = node;
00111   ODLcurrent_aggregate = node;
00112   
00113   /* Place the parameter name and value string into the lexical analyzer's
00114      rescan buffer, along with an END statement to terminate the mini-label
00115      we're creating */
00116 
00117   unput ("\nEND\n");
00118   unput (value_string);
00119   unput ("=");
00120   unput (parameter_name);
00121 
00122   /* Call the parser to read in and process the value. The result will be
00123      a new parameter node (along with the associated value information)
00124      attached to the specified aggregate node */
00125 
00126   if (yyparse() != 0)
00127   {
00128     return (0);
00129   }
00130   else
00131   {
00132     return (1);
00133   }
00134 }
00135
